author: Luke Broadwater
description: President Trump’s decision to fire the head of the Bureau of Labor Statistics forced his allies into the awkward spot of criticizing an agency they had freely cited in the past.
title: When Trump Changes His Mind, Republicans Find a Way to Fall in Line

author: Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs and Jake Ellison
description: Many manhunts end quickly, but the man accused of killing four people in rural Montana appears to have disappeared into the kind of wilderness that helps elude pursuers.
title: How Is the Montana Shooting Suspect Still at Large? Check Out the Terrain.

author: Michael S. Schmidt, Alan Blinder and Michael C. Bender
description: The university was open to spending $500 million, but a $50 million settlement with Brown has prompted new debates in Cambridge.
title: Trump’s Deal-Making With Other Elite Schools Scrambles Harvard Negotiations

author: Jess Bidgood
description: President Trump seized a moment ripe for another redistricting war.
title: The Origins of the Political Power Grab in Texas

author: Alexandra E. Petri
description: The man, Travis Eugene Posey, also injured 11 people in the shooting at the Mad Butcher in Fordyce, Ark., in June 2024. He received four consecutive life terms.
title: Man Who Killed 4 in Arkansas Grocery Store Shooting Gets Life Without Parole

author: Emma G. Fitzsimmons and Benjamin Oreskes
description: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic candidate for mayor of New York City, appeared with Senator Elizabeth Warren to highlight his plan for free universal child care.
title: Elizabeth Warren, Campaigning for Mamdani, Scorns Cuomo and Billionaires

author: Ben Sisario and Julia Jacobs
description: The music mogul, who was convicted in July of two counts of transportation to engage in prostitution, had asked to be released before his sentencing on Oct. 3.
title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Is Denied Bail, and Will Remain Jailed Until Sentencing

author: Matthew Cullen
description: Also, Tesla offered Musk nearly $30 billion in stock. Here’s the latest at the end of Monday.
title: Texas Democrats Fled the State to Fight Redistricting

author: Thomas L. Friedman
description: When Trump fired the top labor statistics official, the aides responsible for running our economy went along for the ride.
title: The America We Knew Is Rapidly Slipping Away

author: Alexa Robles-Gil and Emily Anthes
description: A Danish zoo is asking owners of companion animals nearing life’s end to instead donate them as food for captive lynxes, lions and other carnivores.
title: A Zoo in Denmark Wants to Feed Your Pets to Its Predators

author: Liz Alderman
description: The Swiss government said it had “no indication” the country would be hit with a 39 percent tariff, which is set to take effect this week.
title: Switzerland Rushes to Give Trump ‘More Attractive’ Offer to Cut Tariffs

author: Alan Feuer
description: Legal experts say such concern from the bench could have a more systemic effect, eroding the healthy functioning of the courts.
title: Judges Openly Doubt Government as Justice Dept. Misleads and Dodges Orders

author: Farah Stockman
description: This reality show is short on scandal, betrayal and tears, and has an unusual aim: Elevating U.S. manufacturing.
title: ‘Clash of Trades’ Reality Show Aims to Boost Prestige of US Manufacturing

author: Carl Zimmer
description: A statistical analysis found that the number of fake journal articles being churned out by “paper mills” is doubling every year and a half.
title: Fraudulent Scientific Papers Are Rapidly Increasing, Study Finds

author: Robert Jimison
description: More than a dozen progressive lawmakers had signed onto a draft letter, but a lack of Republican support meant it was unlikely to affect policy decisions by the Trump administration.
title: House Democrats Renew Effort Calling for Palestinian Statehood

author: Grace Ashford
description: New York’s governor welcomed state legislators who fled Texas to thwart a Republican gerrymander but said she would try to draft one of her own to bolster Democrats.
title: With Texans in Tow, Hochul Vows to Redraw New York’s House Maps

author: Stephanie Saul
description: The university is turning to a former law school dean to lead the school as it faces pressure from Republicans in both Virginia and Washington, D.C.
title: University of Virginia Appoints Interim President After Ouster

author: Judson Jones
description: Wildfires burning in Canada were causing unhealthy air quality across parts of North America on Monday.
title: Canada Wildfires Cause Poor Air Quality for Toronto, Minneapolis and New York

author: Kurtis Lee and Mark Abramson
description: A union-backed effort would boost wages for hotel and airport workers. But with tourism down, and the city in a slump, hotel owners fear for their survival.
title: Minimum Wage in L.A. Could Rise to $30 an Hour for Olympics

author: Alice Callahan
description: In a new trial, people consumed more calories and had more cravings when they ate ultraprocessed foods.
title: Avoiding Ultraprocessed Foods Might Double Weight Loss

author: Taylor Robinson
description: Thirteen people were treated for smoke inhalation after the fire ignited early Monday morning. Service was suspended on two lines for nearly five hours.
title: Fire Breaks Out Beneath PATH Train in Jersey City

author: Simar Bajaj
description: A quiet revolution in care is helping patients with cardiac amyloidosis, a form of heart failure that long stumped doctors.
title: What Is Cardiac Amyloidosis?

author: Julia Jacobs
description: Once part of the government’s case against the music mogul, a former girlfriend wrote to a judge in support of Mr. Combs’s request for bail ahead of sentencing.
title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs’s Ex-Girlfriend Supports Bail Release in Letter to Judge

author: Eduardo Medina and Annie Karni
description: The Charleston-area congresswoman was once a moderate Republican, but has more recently presented herself as a loyal supporter of President Trump.
title: Nancy Mace Announces Run for Governor of South Carolina

author: Nataliya Vasilyeva
description: President Trump has given an ultimatum to President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia to end the war in Ukraine or face U.S. sanctions.
title: Trump’s Envoy Is Expected to Visit Russia as U.S. Pushes for Peace Deal in Ukraine

author: Matt Shaw
description: While the president is right to try to reclaim meaning in American architecture, Gilded Age neoclassicism is not the answer.
title: Trump’s Gilded Age White House Ballroom Classicism

author: Jason Karaian
description: The “interim” package announced on Monday was intended to help retain Elon Musk, whose previous pay plan was invalidated by a judge. The car maker’s chief has hinted that he needed a larger stake in the company.
title: Tesla Awards ‘Good Faith’ Shares to Musk Worth $29 Billion

author: Adam B. Kushner
description: We explore the new vibe in Silicon Valley.
title: System Upgrade

author: Tracy Mumford, Will Jarvis, Ian Stewart and Jessica Metzger
description: Plus, why airlines are making everything “premium.”
title: Trump ‘Wants His Own People’ in Charge of Jobs Data, and the Ex-Fox Host Turned U.S. Attorney

author: Andrew Trunsky
description: The White House Historical Association recently unveiled its replica of President Trump’s Oval Office, but it mirrors the office from his first term, before he festooned it with gold.
title: An Oval Office Replica Opens, Without Trump’s Gilded Flourishes

author: Adam Liptak
description: Spikes in the number and influence of briefs filed by historians have prompted questions about the role scholars should play in litigation.
title: As the Supreme Court Focuses on the Past, Historians Turn to Advocacy

author: Nick Corasaniti
description: The Democratic Legislative Campaign Committee is pressing legislatures to counter Republicans’ redistricting efforts in Texas and elsewhere.
title: Democratic Group Calls on Blue States to Draw New House Maps

author: Dana Goldstein
description: A moderate group that has tried to rally Democrats around school choice faces divisions over private-school vouchers.
title: Democrats Disagree (Again). This Time, It’s About School Vouchers.

author: David Wallace-Wells
description: The toxic byproducts of human civilization are everywhere. Even in our bodies.
title: You Are Contaminated

author: Michelle Cottle
description: Creative obstructionism in the Senate, says Tina Smith of Minnesota, has become “a fine art” that has nearly paralyzed the institution.
title: ‘It’s Completely Unappealing’: Why the Senate Is Broken

author: Eileen Sullivan
description: The Washington Litigation Group is the latest nonprofit group to join the legal challenges against the president, with a strategy of focusing on appeals early in the case.
title: New Firm Seeks to Confront Trump on Executive Power

author: Mitch Smith
description: Several candidates want to replace Mike Duggan, the only mayor the city has had since its financial crisis. Detroit’s next challenge, residents say, will be reviving forgotten neighborhoods.
title: 12 Years After Bankruptcy, a Changed Detroit Is Picking a Mayor

author: Ben Austen
description: Measures intended to punish elite universities are inflicting collateral damage on the nation’s two-year colleges, which educate 40 percent of all undergraduates.
title: Community Colleges Have Been Hit by Trump’s War on Elite Universities

author: Luis Ferré-Sadurní, Leila Medina, Melanie Bencosme, Gabriel Blanco, June Kim, Alex Pena and David Seekamp
description: Immigration crackdowns have unfolded in broad daylight across the country, but in New York City, most detentions have been quietly concentrated in a single building. Luis Ferré-Sadurní takes us to the epicenter of these detentions.
title: Inside the Epicenter of ICE Detentions in NYC

author: Nicole Sperling
description: Brandon Riegg pushed the streaming service to invest in live shows and sports, transforming Netflix into something more like a traditional TV network.
title: The ‘Troublemaker’ Behind Netflix’s Biggest Gamble

author: Luis Ferré-Sadurní, Ashley Cai and Todd Heisler
description: More than half of the immigrants arrested in the New York City area since Jan. 20 do not have criminal convictions or charges, new data shows.
title: Trump’s Immigrant Crackdown in New York: More Arrests, Longer Detention

author: Liam Stack
description: Zohran Mamdani won over Jewish voters in New York City who were energized by his economic agenda and unbothered by — or sympathetic to — his views on Israel and Gaza.
title: Many Jewish Voters Back Mamdani. And Many Agree With Him on Gaza.

author: Gioconda Belli
description: Thousands of dissidents have fled Daniel Ortega’s Nicaragua — and now, even those of us in exile no longer feel safe.
title: I Was Banished by My Country’s Dictator. What Happened to Me Is a Warning.

author: Alexandra Stevenson and Zunaira Saieed
description: Once a cog in the Malaysian economy, the solar industry profited from Chinese investment. Now it’s becoming a case study of what happens when the United States closes its markets.
title: What’s It Like to Deal With Brutal U.S. Tariffs? Ask Malaysia.
